content:
To improve search retrieval of the chunk about querying and setting positions relative to another NodePath, place it in a section discussing transformations or positioning within the scene graph.

**Context:**
"For more advanced operations, you can also set or query the position (or other transform properties) of a NodePath with respect to another one."

This context situates the chunk within discussions about node transformations and relative positioning.

You can also query the current transform information for any of the above:

python

myNodePath.getPos()
myNodePath.getX()
myNodePath.getY()
myNodePath.getZ()

cpp

myNodePath.get_pos();
myNodePath.get_x();
myNodePath.get_y();
myNodePath.get_z();

As a more advanced feature, you may also set or query the position (or any of the above transform properties) of a particular NodePath with respect to another one. To do this, specify the relative NodePath as the first parameter:

python

myNodePath.setPos(otherNodePath, X, Y, Z)
myNodePath.getPos(otherNodePath)

cpp

myNodePath.set_pos(otherNodePath, X, Y, Z);
myNodePath.get_pos(otherNodePath);
